lines.content: * Main entry point for the Langley application.
* Initializes the necessary components and starts the command loop for user interaction.
ui.print("Error: ToDo description cannot be empty.");
ui.print("Added a new Deadline: " + parts[0].trim() + " (by: " + parts[1].trim() + ")");
ui.print("Error: Deadline command format is 'deadline x /by time'.");
ui.print("Added a new Event: " + parts[0].trim() + " (from: " + parts[1].trim() + " to: " + parts[2].trim() + ")");
ui.print("Error: Event command format is 'event x /from time /to time'.");
ui.print("Unknown command. Available commands: list, mark, unmark, todo, deadline, event, delete, bye.");
* Parses the user's input into a command and its arguments.
* The input is split into two parts: the command and the rest.
* @param userInput The input entered by the user.
* @return A string array containing the command and its arguments.
* Saves the given list of tasks to the file specified by the file path.
* @param tasks List of tasks to save.
* @throws IOException If an I/O error occurs during file writing.
System.out.println("Error: Unable to save tasks to file.");
* Loads tasks from the file into the provided task list.
* If the file does not exist, no tasks are loaded.
* @param tasks List to populate with tasks from the file.
* @throws IOException If an I/O error occurs during file reading.
System.out.println("Error: Unable to load tasks from file.");
* Adds a task to the task list.
* @param task Task to be added to the list.
* Deletes a task from the task list by its index.
* @param index Index of the task to be deleted.
* Marks the task at the specified index as completed.
* @param index Index of the task to be marked.
* Unmarks the task at the specified index, marking it as incomplete.
* @param index Index of the task to be unmarked.
* Lists all tasks currently in the task list, printing them with their index and status.
public Event(String description, String from, String to) {
* Converts a string representation of a task back into a Task object.
* Parses the string for type, status, and task details.
* @param line The string representing a task.
* @return The corresponding Task object or null if parsing fails.
task.mark(); // Mark the task as completed
